p: The δ 13C values of organic carbon in sediment ranged from −24.8 to −21.6‰ and from −24.5 to −21.7‰, with an average value of −23.4 and −23.1‰ for the ECH and WCH, respectively ( Figure 4d). Both cores showed a depleting trend of δ 13C values since the 1860s. The values of δ 15N showed an opposite distribution character with an increasing trend from the bottom to the top ( Figure 4e). The values at the ECH ranged from +2.07 to +7.57‰, with an average value of +5.13‰. The values at the WCH varied from +1.73 to +10.42‰, with an average of +5.69‰. For the values of δ 13C and δ 15N, no significant difference between the ECH and WCH was observed throughout the profiles.
